speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: I will be even with thee, doubt it not.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: But why, why, why?

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Thou hast forspoke my being in these wars,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: And say'st it is not fit.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Well, is it, is it?

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: If not denounced against us, why should not we

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Be there in person?

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: [Aside]  Well, I could reply:

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: If we should serve with horse and mares together,

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: The horse were merely lost; the mares would bear

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: A soldier and his horse.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: What is't you say?

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Your presence needs must puzzle Antony;

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Take from his heart, take from his brain,

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: from's time,

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: What should not then be spared. He is already

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Traduced for levity; and 'tis said in Rome

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: That Photinus an eunuch and your maids

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Manage this war.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Sink Rome, and their tongues rot

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: That speak against us! A charge we bear i' the war,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: And, as the president of my kingdom, will

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Appear there for a man. Speak not against it:

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: I will not stay behind.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Nay, I have done.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Here comes the emperor.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Enter MARK ANTONY and CANIDIUS

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Is it not strange, Canidius,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: That from Tarentum and Brundusium

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: He could so quickly cut the Ionian sea,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: And take in Toryne? You have heard on't, sweet?

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Celerity is never more admired

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Than by the negligent.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: A good rebuke,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Which might have well becomed the best of men,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: To taunt at slackness. Canidius, we

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Will fight with him by sea.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: By sea! what else?

speaker: CANIDIUS
text_entry: Why will my lord do so?

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: For that he dares us to't.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: So hath my lord dared him to single fight.

speaker: CANIDIUS
text_entry: Ay, and to wage this battle at Pharsalia.

speaker: CANIDIUS
text_entry: Where Caesar fought with Pompey: but these offers,

speaker: CANIDIUS
text_entry: Which serve not for his vantage, be shakes off;

speaker: CANIDIUS
text_entry: And so should you.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Your ships are not well mann'd;

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Your mariners are muleters, reapers, people

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Ingross'd by swift impress; in Caesar's fleet

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Are those that often have 'gainst Pompey fought:

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Their ships are yare; yours, heavy: no disgrace

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Shall fall you for refusing him at sea,

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Being prepared for land.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: By sea, by sea.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Most worthy sir, you therein throw away

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: The absolute soldiership you have by land;

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Distract your army, which doth most consist

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Of war-mark'd footmen; leave unexecuted

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Your own renowned knowledge; quite forego

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: The way which promises assurance; and

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Give up yourself merely to chance and hazard,

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: From firm security.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: I'll fight at sea.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: I have sixty sails, Caesar none better.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Our overplus of shipping will we burn;

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: And, with the rest full-mann'd, from the head of Actium

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Beat the approaching Caesar. But if we fail,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: We then can do't at land.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Enter a Messenger

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Thy business?

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: The news is true, my lord; he is descried;

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Caesar has taken Toryne.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Can he be there in person? 'tis impossible;

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Strange that power should be. Canidius,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Our nineteen legions thou shalt hold by land,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: And our twelve thousand horse. We'll to our ship:

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Away, my Thetis!

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Enter a Soldier

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: How now, worthy soldier?

speaker: Soldier
text_entry: O noble emperor, do not fight by sea;

speaker: Soldier
text_entry: Trust not to rotten planks: do you misdoubt

speaker: Soldier
text_entry: This sword and these my wounds? Let the Egyptians

speaker: Soldier
text_entry: And the Phoenicians go a-ducking; we

speaker: Soldier
text_entry: Have used to conquer, standing on the earth,

speaker: Soldier
text_entry: And fighting foot to foot.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Well, well: away!

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Exeunt MARK ANTONY, QUEEN CLEOPATRA, and DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS

speaker: Soldier
text_entry: By Hercules, I think I am i' the right.

speaker: CANIDIUS
text_entry: Soldier, thou art: but his whole action grows

speaker: CANIDIUS
text_entry: Not in the power on't: so our leader's led,

speaker: CANIDIUS
text_entry: And we are women's men.

speaker: Soldier
text_entry: You keep by land

speaker: Soldier
text_entry: The legions and the horse whole, do you not?

speaker: CANIDIUS
text_entry: Marcus Octavius, Marcus Justeius,

speaker: CANIDIUS
text_entry: Publicola, and Caelius, are for sea:

speaker: CANIDIUS
text_entry: But we keep whole by land. This speed of Caesar's

speaker: CANIDIUS
text_entry: Carries beyond belief.

speaker: Soldier
text_entry: While he was yet in Rome,

speaker: Soldier
text_entry: His power went out in such distractions as

speaker: Soldier
text_entry: Beguiled all spies.

speaker: CANIDIUS
text_entry: Who's his lieutenant, hear you?

speaker: Soldier
text_entry: They say, one Taurus.

speaker: CANIDIUS
text_entry: Well I know the man.

speaker: CANIDIUS
text_entry: Enter a Messenger

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: The emperor calls Canidius.

speaker: CANIDIUS
text_entry: With news the time's with labour, and throes forth,

speaker: CANIDIUS
text_entry: Each minute, some.

speaker: CANIDIUS
text_entry: Exeunt
